subject: fw-update: Create RF message registries for firmware update
commitMessage:
fw-update: Create RF message registries for firmware update

This patch creates Redfish message registry entries for firmware
update based on http://redfish.dmtf.org/registries/Update.1.0.0.json.
The entries are logged in the phosphor::logging application by
invoking the Logging.Create API. bmcweb uses the REDFISH_MESSAGE_ID
and REDFISH_MESSAGE_ARGS in the AdditionalData to create the message
registry entry.

The firmware update registry entries can be read using the LogServices
API or through the TaskService for the firmware update task.

This patch requires firmware update config json to translate component
identifier to component name string and can work without firmware
update config JSON by using component identifiers instead of component
names.

Tested:

Completed PLDM firmware update and the following is a sample of message
registry that is added.

{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/EventLog/Entries/425",
  "@odata.type": "#LogEntry.v1_9_0.LogEntry",
  "Created": "2022-03-21T09:35:13+00:00",
  "EntryType": "Event",
  "Id": "425",
  "Message": "Awaiting for an action to proceed with activating image 'IMAGE_XYZ' on 'DEVICE_XYZ'.",
  "MessageArgs": [
    "IMAGE_XYZ",
    "DEVICE_XYZ"
  ],
  "MessageId": "Update.1.0.AwaitToActivate",
  "Name": "System Event Log Entry",
  "Resolution": "System reboot",
  "Severity": "OK"
},

Signed-off-by: hsangani <hsangani@nvidia.com>
Change-Id: Id68e0b0a1a09935b757835c451aa65dc69167d83

fw_update: Create message registries for firmware update

Tested: 

Completed PLDM firmware update and the following is a sample of message registry that is added.

functions are lowerCamelCase like 

void UpdateManager:createMsgRegistryLog(...
This is not probably necessary here.
nit: lowerCamelCase for variables, add_data -> addData
Can we move this to the section before if ()
Why is a change showing up? We can remove it in the next patch.
Please fix this for all header/source files in this patch.
Shouldn't this be Update.1.0.0.TransferFailed instead of Update.1.0.TransferFailed?
We can cleanup this trace, in case we add specific handling for completion codes we can add it back.
We can add it back, when we add support for error handling.
We need to map the resolution to activation method response from the FD.
I think this should be applicable for all the components.
We need to update device completion to fail.
Component name info for components applicable for the FD
Let's make this a public variable, plain getters/setters are not encouraged.
Component name info for components applicable for the FD
I think the editor is adding newline at the end of all these files.
This can throw an exception if eid is not present in the data structure, we need to handle it gracefully.
we can rename fd_map to more recognizable variable name + lowerCamelCase

MessageRegistry would still be needed if JSON s not provided. So can we use ComponentIdentifier, if ComponentName is not available. So if component identifier is 0x0102 we can use that or the decimal equivalent in the message.

"Message": "Awaiting for an action to proceed with activating image 'IMAGE_XYZ' on '0x0102'.",
can you also state why ? and what is the intention behind doing that explicity in the commit message - and any design documents or logging commits that are tied up to this commit.

+1

There are no specific logging commits needed for this. The upstream D-Bus based phosphor-logging API is the expectation.
Done, will update the firmware update design document.

why are we not creating util functions for these (rather than writing these in fw-update) ? seems like that would be the right place for these ..as other components of the code can leverage this code (if needed)

The rationale was to localize fw-update message registries to that module. The implementation is very specific to firmware update message registries. If a common util function was written for all message registries(and handling its nuances) would have cluttered implementation.
is there a design docuement ? or a pre-commit in logging that i should look at to understand if the keys like REDFISH_MESSAGE_ID e.t.c are standard ?

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/docs/+/20110 - The design direction is the same as one described in this design doc. In this case, D-Bus based logging is used and will be preferred over 

Following is an example of consuming it in bmcweb(even though there are more questions to be cleared) https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/48976.

> https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/docs/+/20110 - The design direction is the same as one described in this design doc. In this case, D-Bus based logging is used and will be preferred over 
> 
Ack
> Following is an example of consuming it in bmcweb(even though there are more questions to be cleared) https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/48976.

Tom - the bmcweb commit does not seem to be pursued anymore(last update was in November) ? and seems like there are some valid concerns about the message id being present & versioning of the message registries - and those are not really answered ? can we hold this patch until we have the bmcweb portion sorted out.

That above was an example for similar usage. 

It seems there are quite a bit of upstream repos[1] following the same IDs and redfish arch doc[2] is also making a mention of it

[1] https://grok.openbmc.org/search?full=%22REDFISH_MESSAGE_ID%22&defs=&refs=&path=&hist=&type=&xrd=&nn=1&si=full&searchall=true&si=full

[2] https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/architecture/redfish-logging-in-bmcweb.md#journal-based-redfish-logging
input paramters should be const right ?
Not necessary for POD types, eid is a uint8_t
Do we need messageID variable? Pass updateManager->transferFailed to createMessageRegistry
This API doesn't have documentation, and I don't understand why this is related to the message registries patch.

Sure, will add documentation. This patch is also addressing failure scenarios as well. So this particular scenario handles the scenario where no response is received from FD for RequestUpdate commands.
Tom, Hardik - we should separate out failure handling and message registries into separate commits.
Done, moving this to a follow-up patch.
pass updateManager->transferFailed, update throughout this patch.

1. class enumeration for the offsets
2. std::unordered_map for value to the string

Why static inline? We can have this data structure in fw_update namespace.
Removed in the next patch, this should be revisited in the context of version check and other conditions and doesn't deem directly to be a transfer failure.
Moving this to a follow-up patch
Moving this to a follow-up patch.
Why are we sending response here? The response needs to be sent to the FD.
